availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Felix G. Wilkinson (Trigg County, Kentucky, carpenter.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of Bryan Wilkinson and Rosabella B. Wilkinson. Attended school in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Carpenter in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 292A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 192.
"Felix G. Wilkinson (1839-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial 127833389, accessed April 20, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127833389.
